title: Voluntary Fasts besides Fardh Fasts of Ramadhaan - Dr Zakir Naik
transcript: what are the voluntary fasts as recommended by the Prophet Muhammad sallallahu alaihi waslam as far as voluntary fast are concerned besides the days which are further profast that's the month of Ramadan and those days which are prohibited to fast a Muslim can fast on any other day in the full year but there are certain days which the prophet has recommended where a Muslim if he fast it is much more preferable and he'll get Musa first is fasting in the month of Muharram especially Ashura number two is fasting on the day of arafah number three is fasting during the first 10 days of the month of Dil Hajj number four fasting in the month of shawwal number five is fasting in the month of Shaban number six is fasting during the foreign months The Forbidden months number seven is fasting on the ayamul bid that's three days in the month 13 14 then 15th of every month number eight is fasting on Mondays and Thursdays and number nine is fasting on Alternate days of the year so these are the nine types of fast which the prophet had specially recommended
